ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: western blot, PCR, RT-PCR, IHC, etc
Learning the basics of different laboratory techniques and how to perform them (Western Blot, PCR, staining, IHC)
I learned lab techniques I've always wanted to learn, in an environment where I felt comfortable asking questions
This class taught a lot of useful lab skills and reinforced reproduction biology concepts form the lecture.
Basic lab skills - PCR, Wedtern blotting, immuno-staining etc

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: very good course. Easy to follow. Not too much work. recommend to take with lecture, but youll also be fine without the lecture knowledge
No weaknesses - such a fun and engaging lab!!
Very well planned and organized course, very enjoyable

The class was very digestible and had well thought out experiments. An improvement to the class would be to get the homework assignments released earlier to give us more time to do it. The assignments didnt take long, but the short time frame to compete them didnt leave a lot of time to ask questions or add the class kinda stressful especially when you had other assignments due.

Great class! Labs are straightforward and procedures easy to follow; I also liked that the labs were done in groups/pairs -lab work should be collaborative! Homeworks were also very straightforward and didnt take too long I liked that there were no tedious and long lab reports. One thing -a better explanation of the procedures and background information for each lab should be provided beforehand.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely!! One of the best teaching labs Ive taken at Yale.
Yes -- amazing course if you can get a spot
Yes, relatively low workload and rewarding content to learn.

Yes! Great lab class that is very little work (one hw every couple of weeks with a few straightforward questions to answer) and professors are really kind. Also all work is done in groups/pairs and you carry out the steps of each procedure with the professor/class which is great -avoids confusion. You also learn basic lab techniques that are applicable in a wide variety of contexts outside repro lab which is very helpful!
